business.headline: Silver slips after hitting record high of Rs 2.04 lakh/kg in Delhi, gold flatSpot silver was trading 0.56 per cent higher at USD 65.85 per ounce in the overseas trade.

From ports to airports: What pushed Adani Group into aviationJeet Adani, Gautam Adani's younger son and a director at Adani Airports, said the experience gained in ports and logistics helped the group enter aviation with confidence.

Why Jeet Adani says resilience is the next big challenge for Indian aviationWhile speaking to India Today, Adani said that aviation is a fragile system in which even small issues can quickly escalate into major problems.

Navi Mumbai airport will be one of most sustainable airports in world: Jeet AdaniSpeaking in the 'Jab We Met' segment, Jeet Adani said development and ecology should not be viewed as opposing ideas. He said large infrastructure projects must grow in a way that protects natural systems, as this also helps safeguard long-term assets and operations.
Built for the future: Jeet Adani on how Navi Mumbai Airport changes Mumbai aviationJeet Adani said the new airport will unlock long-term growth and improve global connectivity for the city.

Avadhut Sathe gets interim relief as SAT defreezes accounts for expensesIn August, Sebi conducted a search-and-seizure operation at Avadhut Sathe's Karjat Trading Academy as part of a broader crackdown on financial influencers offering market advice without proper registration.
Sensex ends 447 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; RIL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 447.55 points to close at 84,929.36, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 150.85 points to end at 25,966.40.

Got an SMS or email from the Income Tax Department? Here's what it meansGot an unexpected SMS or email from the Income Tax Department about your transactions and unsure what to do next? The department has clarified the purpose behind these alerts.

Adani Group to bid for 11 airports amid India's air travel boom: ReportThe Indian government has been leasing out government-owned airports on long-term contracts to private companies. At the same time, it is encouraging the construction of new airports to improve connectivity across the country.

8th Pay Commission update: How big could be the salary hike and what to expectWith the 7th Pay Commission ending in December 2025, what kind of salary hike can central government employees realistically expect under the 8th Pay Commission, and when will the money actually come? Let's have a look.

ICICI Prudential AMC makes strong debut: What long, short-term investors should doICICI Prudential AMC share price: The listing was slightly below grey market expectations. Ahead of the debut, the IPO was commanding a grey market premium of Rs 520–530, which had indicated possible listing gains of around 24%.

ICICI Prudential AMC shares list at 20% premium: Hold or sell?Shares of ICICI Prudential AMC debuted at Rs 2,606.20 on the BSE, marking a premium of 20.38% over the IPO issue price of Rs 2,165. On the NSE, the stock opened at around Rs 2,600, up 20.09%.
Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising today?At around 9:45 am, the S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 147.50 points to 25,963.30.

Ola Electric shares fall over 60% this year: What should investors do?The stock has now fallen nearly 63% in calendar year 2025, making it one of the worst-performing newly listed technology stocks this year. Ola Electric shares hit a fresh 52-week low of Rs 31.54 on Thursday.

Japan's central bank raises rates to 0.75%, highest in 30 yearsThe Bank of Japan raised its short-term policy rate to 0.75% from 0.5%, its first rate hike since January. In a statement, the Bank of Japan said that even after the hike, financial conditions would remain supportive for the economy

How aluminium is changing the job story in India's mineral-rich statesIndustry estimates cited by the Aluminium Association of India show that the sector has already generated over eight lakh jobs and supports 4,000 SMEs in its downstream ecosystem.
Sensex opens 300 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; Infosys up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 147.50 points to 25,963.30 as of 9:45 am.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO listing today: Is GMP pointing to gains for investors?The ICICI Prudential AMC IPO saw very strong demand during its three-day bidding period. The issue was subscribed 39.17 times overall.

Your SIP stayed at Rs 5,000 over the years. How not increasing it 10% cost you lakhsYour salary rose, expenses changed, but your SIP remained at Rs 5,000. Over time, this small choice can quietly cost you several lakhs in missed wealth. Let's understand how.

Why some IPO stocks keep running for days after listing, explains Nithin KamathIPO stocks continuing to rise after listing may seem puzzling.  Nithin Kamath breaks down a technical reason that is often overlooked by retail investors.

entertainment.headline: Malayalam legend Sreenivasan dies at 69, Prithviraj Sukumaran pays tribute Veteran actor Sreenivasan died at the age of 69, leaving behind a significant legacy in the Malayalam film industry. His work as an actor, writer, and filmmaker shaped the course of Malayalam cinema for nearly five decades.

It's going to be worse: Rakesh Bedi teases his role's darker turn in Dhurandhar 2 Rakesh Bedi shared insights on his character's development in the sequel to 'Dhurandhar' and highlighted the shift from comedic roles to a more complex portrayal. The espionage thriller continues to perform strongly at the box office.

Rehman Dakait, Abrar, Rukma: New-age villains are stealing spotlight from the hero Today's Indian cinema features villains with emotional depth and complexity. These characters challenge traditional hero roles, reshaping storytelling and audience engagement.

JungKook's Golden Exhibition in Mumbai to BTS' parent company HYBE launch in India | Bang Si-Hyuk​ K-pop in India is entering a new phase, and Mumbai is at the centre of it. Starting December 12, Jungkook of BTS opened his first-ever solo exhibition in India, drawing fans from across the country and marking the first official BTS-related on-ground activity here. Know more on this.

Nick Jonas sends love to Ranveer after actor reacts to his viral Dhurandhar dance Nick Jonas sent his love to Ranveer Sigh and his family after the Bollywood star recently reacted to the singer's viral 'Dhurandhar' video. The film released in theatres on December 5.

Dhurandhar's Rs 1,000 crore box office march, and the new Hindi cinema order Dhurandhar eyes the Rs 1,000 crore global club after nearing Rs 500 crore nett in India. What the film's historic run means for Hindi cinema, Ranveer Singh, and Bollywood's evolving box office rules.

Mrunal Thakur on balancing Hindi and Telugu cinema: I like pushing my boundaries Mrunal Thakur shared her perspective on balancing work between Hindi and Telugu cinema. While speaking to India Today, she emphasised her interest in taking on new challenges and expanding her horizons.

Agastya Nanda: Ikkis felt like my last chance to prove myself Agastya Nanda has said that his upcoming film 'Ikkis' felt like his last opportunity to prove himself, highlighting the significance of war-drama for him. 'Ikkis' also features late actor Dharmendra in a pivotal character.

Radhika Apte on seeking therapy, being dropped from a film over 3-4 kilos Radhika Apte spoke to India Today about losing a film role over just a few kilos — which pushed her to therapy. She highlighted the film industry's body image and weight issues.

Agastya Nanda on working with Dharmendra in Ikkis: He was always involved Agastya Nanda shared his experience of working with late actor Dharmendra in the upcoming war-drama 'Ikkis' (2026). The actor spoke to India Today, about sharing screen-space with Dharmendra.

James Cameron addresses Matt Damon's claim on turning down Avatar profit share James Cameron has responded to Matt Damon's claim about turning down a 10 percent share of 'Avatar', disputing the actor's widely circulated claim and clarifying his perspective on the matter.

Dhurandhar director Aditya Dhar says he finally feels seen, after copious praise from RGV Aditya Dhar's emotional response to Ram Gopal Varma's Dhurandhar review sparked a rare filmmaker-to-filmmaker exchange on influence, originality, and the evolving language of Indian cinema.

Exclusive: Inside K-drama Don't Call Me Ma'am with Kim Hee-seon, Han Hye-jin The South-Korean series 'Don't Call Me Ma'am', led by Kim Hee-seon, Han Hye-jin and Jin Seo-yeon, examines life after ambition and marriage, focusing on reinvention and emotional truth. Kim, in an interview with India Today, also expressed her desire to visit India in future.

Emily in Paris 5 review: Emily Cooper needs a reset, not another cityRelease Date:Thu Dec 18, 2025 Emily in Paris returns with familiar charm, exploring Emily Cooper's personal growth amid romantic and professional dilemmas in vibrant Paris and Rome. Despite a slow start, the season can make for a comforting watch for fans.

The Sheep Detectives trailer: Will shepherd Hugh Jackman's sheep solve a murder? The trailer of the mystery-comedy 'The Sheep Detectives', shows shepherd Hugh Jackman's sheep set to solve a murder mystery. The film also features Emma Thompson in a pivotal character.

Is Kartik Aaryan the masked Punjabi singer Talwiinder? Fans speculate Ahead of 'Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri' release, fans are noting the similarity in the physical appearance of Punjabi singer Talwiinder and Kartik Aaryan. The movie will hit theatres on December 25.

Barack Obama's 2025 movie recommendations: Sinners, Jay Kelly, Hamnet and more Former president Barack Obama maintained his yearly practice by publicly releasing his 2025 selections for favourite movies, books, and music. He has observed the tradition each December since his time in the White House.

Akshaye Khanna-Sunny Deol to reunite 29 years after Border on a Netflix film: Reports Akshaye Khanna and Sunny Deol are reportedly teaming up 29 years after Border. The two are believed to be in the best phase of their careers, after the success of Gadar 2 and Dhurandhar.

general news.headline: 8 elephants killed, 5 coaches of Rajdhani Express derail in Assam accidentFollowing the incident, senior railway officers, including the General Manager of NF Railway and the Divisional Railway Manager of Lumding, rushed to the site. Under their supervision, the passengers of the affected berths were temporarily accommodated in the vacant berths available in other coaches.

Left me bleeding: Flyer claims assault by Air India Express pilot at Delhi AirportAir India Express has removed the accused pilot from official duties with immediate effect, pending an internal inquiry into the alleged assault incident that took place at Terminal 1 of Delhi Airport.

1st batch of Epstein files shows Clinton in hot tub, has little mention of TrumpThe US Justice Department's Epstein files included photographs showing younger-looking Bill Clinton with Ghislaine Maxwell, in a swimming pool, and alongside Michael Jackson and Diana Ross.

This private factory wants to make one new space rocket every monthThis immersive story follows a full day spent inside the high-security facility where engineers, technicians, and scientists are racing against time to prepare Vikram-I, the startup's first orbital launch vehicle, for its upcoming space mission.

US launches Operation Hawkeye Strike after ISIS killed three Americans in SyriaUS forces launched Operation Hawkeye Strike in Syria against ISIS following a deadly Palmyra attack that killed three Americans. Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth confirmed heavy losses inflicted on ISIS fighters.

India, China playing cat-and-mouse games in Bay of Bengal?Since the last week of November, India has issued three Notams (Notice to Airmen) only to cancel them at the eleventh hour. It has coincided with China's sudden deployment of as many as five 'spy' vessels. What's brewing in India's backyard?

Why H-1B is being used to hire teachers in USNot just techies, teachers too are hired in the US through the H-1B programme. This came into focus as the California Department of Education said its school districts filed more than 300 H-1B visa applications for 2023–24, double the number from two years earlier. The US faces a critical shortage of school teachers, and the high fees on new H-1B visas might add to the crisis. States like California have sued the Trump administration.

Delhi-NCR running blind, extreme fog cuts visibility to a few metres, flights hitDense fog and air pollution continue to disrupt daily life in Delhi and the National Capital Region, affecting visibility and transport services. Authorities have issued alerts.

Suryakumar Yadav unlikely to continue as T20I captain after T20 World Cup: ReportThe BCCI is all set to announce India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad on Saturday, December 20. However, as per the reports, captain Suryakumar Yadav, 35, is unlikely to continue beyond the T20 extravaganza, starting February 7 in India and Sri Lanka.

India's first woman meteorologist worked under Sir CV Raman but never got her PhdAnna Mani overcame gender barriers to pioneer meteorology in India. Her work enabled India's self-reliance in climate science despite limited formal recognition.

Live: Daily Star calls attack on office 'Black Day for Journalism'Bangladesh Protests Live Updates: Bangladesh will hold the funeral of the radical, anti-India youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi today under heightened security after his death sparked unrest across the country. The interim government said the funeral prayer will take place at the South Plaza of the National Parliament Building at 2 pm. Authorities also announced there will be no public viewing of the body and appealed to people to offer prayers while maintaining order. The body arrived in Dhaka from Singapore on Friday, following which the interim government urged citizens to resist violence by what it described as "fringe elements". In a late Thursday televised address, Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus promised swift justice in the killing, asserting that "no leniency will be shown" to those responsible. Despite the appeal, several areas witnessed attacks and vandalism on Thursday night, including stone-pelting at the residence of the Assistant Indian High Commissioner in Chattogram, shortly after Yunus confirmed Hadi's death. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Watch: Russian journalist proposes to girlfriend during live presser with PutinA Russian journalist stunned viewers by proposing to his girlfriend during Vladimir Putin's live year-end press conference, drawing applause and getting a playful response from the Russian President himself.

Indians using rishwat to game H-1B programme, says US diplomat who served in IndiaIndian-origin US diplomat Mahvash Siddiqui, writing for an anti-immigration think tank, alleged that the H-1B visa programme has turned into a de facto immigration shortcut dominated by India. She claimed that unqualified Indian applicants use fraud and bribery to enter the US, even as she urged the US to pause the visa programme pending a full audit.

The all-rounder went over to check on him immediately after the final delivery of the match was bowled.

Video: Moment when Taiwan attacker unleashed smoke bombs, went on killing spreeThe incident killed three people and left more than five people injured. The man was also eventually killed during a police chase after he fell from a building.

Gill out, firepower In: Why India must unleash Sanjushek in T20IsThe Indian team found their attacking mojo once again and it was no surprise that reinstallation of Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma at the top led to the change. While Shubman Gill remains a fine player, India needs to replace finesse with firepower if they want to retain their T20 World Cup crown.
Smoke, smog and selective outrage: Are global AQI advisories on Delhi a double standard?Every winter, Delhi's air becomes a public health emergency. This year, it also became a diplomatic one.

Will rock entire Bangladesh: What Osman Hadi's shooter boasted to his girlfriendHours before the fatal attack on anti-India leader Sharif Osman Hadi, the alleged shooter, Faisal Karim, told his girlfriend that "something was coming that would shake the entire country". The warning proved eerily true as Bangladesh is now reeling from violence ahead of crucial February 2026 elections.

Navi Mumbai Airport will unlock growth and global connectivity: Jeet AdaniIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Jeet Adani, Director – Airports, Adani Airports Holdings Ltd (AAHL), said the upcoming Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) will unlock long-term growth and improve global connectivity for the city.

sports.headline: IPL auction: What happened to the uncapped crorepatis of the past? IPL auction: Before the Chennai Super Kings splurged Rs 14.2 crore each on Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma, the IPL had seen several uncapped crorepatis. Here's where those bets led.

T20 World Cup squad reveal live: India Selectors and Suryakumar meet in Mumbai Team India Squad Announcement Live Updates: India's selectors led by chief Ajit Agarkar and T20I skipper Suryakumar Yadav will all meet in BCCI's Mumbai headquarters to finalise their squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Both Agarkar and Suryakumar will address a press conference after discussion.

Not Bumrah, Pandya was the difference between two teams: South Africa coach South Africa head coach Shukri Conrad has showered praise on Hardik Pandya following his terrific all-round performance in the T20I series. Pandya was adjudged Player of the Match following his breathtaking innings of 63 (25).

When Hardik Pandya lit up Ahmedabad with Sir Viv-esque swagger Hardik Pandya's swagger-lit masterclass against South Africa had echoes of Sir Vivian Richards, according to Robin Uthappa. The former India batter believes such intimidation-driven cricket defines India's ideal T20 template going forward.

Mohamed Salah is his own man, apologised to Liverpool dressing room: Teammate reveals Curtis Jones revealed Mohamed Salah apologised to Liverpool teammates after controversy. The midfielder said the dressing room stayed united, insisting Salah's comments reflected elite competitiveness rather than any intent to destabilise Arne Slot's squad.

Rohit Sharma set to miss first few Vijay Hazare Trophy matches. Here's why Rohit Sharma will miss Mumbai's opening Vijay Hazare Trophy matches as selectors prioritise testing emerging talent this season. The call has dampened fan excitement, especially with senior stars returning to domestic cricket spotlight nationwide anticipation.

Gill out, firepower In: Why India must unleash Sanjushek in T20Is The Indian team found their attacking mojo once again and it was no surprise that reinstallation of Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma at the top led to the change. While Shubman Gill remains a fine player, India needs to replace finesse with firepower if they want to retain their T20 World Cup crown.

India to announce T20 World Cup squad today. Will selectors back out-of-form Shubman Gill? Shubman Gill's role in the squad will be the main focus as India will announce their side for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 on Saturday, December 20. With the team also mos well-set, will the selectors throw a few curveballs at the fans with some bold choices?

Watch: Hardik applies ice pack to cameraman hit by his six in Ahmedabad T20I India vs South Africa: One of Hardik Pandya's five monstrous sixes struck a cameraman at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Friday. The all-rounder went over to check on him immediately after the final delivery of the match was bowled.

Surya, the batter, is missing: Captain's frank take on eve of T20 World Cup selectionIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav delivered a blunt verdict on his own form after the South Africa series. The Indian skipper said that he went missing in action as a batter for the side during the series win against the Proteas.

When Hardik Pandya kept promise to girlfriend during the Ahmedabad blitzIND vs SA, 5th T20I: Hardik Pandya kept a promise to his girlfriend by attacking the very first ball and delivering a spectacular 63, powering India to a 3-1 T20I series victory over South Africa in Ahmedabad.

5th T20I: Gill-less India flaunt all-round might, end 2025 with series victoryIND vs SA, 5th T20I: Tilak Varma and Hardik Pandya struck commanding half-centuries, while spinner Varun Chakravarthy claimed four wickets as India defeated South Africa by 30 runs on Saturday to clinch the five-match T20I series 3-1.

It's official. Virat Kohli will play domestic one-dayers for DelhiVirat Kohli is expected to play a couple of Vijay Hazare Trophy matches for Delhi. The Delhi state body named a 16-man squad and added Kohli, Rishabh Pant, Ishant Sharma, Harshit Rana and Navdeep Saini additionally.

ISL clubs propose club-owned league model, AIFF to be regulatorIndian Super League clubs on Friday proposed a major overhaul of the country's top-tier football league, seeking perpetual operational and commercial rights under a club-owned model, with the AIFF continuing as the regulator.

Hardik blows kisses to Mahieka Sharma after record T20I fifty in AhmedabadHardik Pandya scored a sensational fifty and sent kisses to his girlfriend Mahieka Sharma after thrilling the Ahmedabad crowd during the final match of the series against South Africa on Friday, December 19.

Suryakumar dejected after another failure, ends 2025 without a single T20I fiftyIndia vs South Africa: Suryakumar Yadav cut a dejected figure after another failure with the bat in the fifth T20I, as the India captain ended 2025 without a single T20I fifty and continued his prolonged batting slump.

Amorim breaks silence on bombshell Fernandes interview, 'free Mainoo' shirtManchester United manager Ruben Amorim has broken his silence on Bruno Fernandes' comments and the controversy surrounding Kobbie Mainoo's brother wearing a 'Free Kobbie Mainoo' T-shirt ahead of the Premier League clash against Aston Villa.

Ahmedabad T20I: Abhishek misses out on Kohli's all-time record by a whiskerAbhishek Sharma missed Virat Kohli's all-time T20 record for India by a whisker as his incredible 2025 came to an end in Ahmedabad. Abhishek scored 34 off 20 balls and missed Kohli's record by 12 runs.

After dream RCB deal, Vihaan Malhotra stuns with 35-ball fifty in U19 Asia Cup semisVihaan Malhotra starred with a 35-ball fifty against Sri Lanka to guide India into the U19 Asia Cup 2025 final, just days after securing his first IPL contract with Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

Why is Sanju not there? Ravi Shastri makes explosive Samson vs Gill comment on airFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri made explosive remarks on air comparing Sanju Samson and Shubman Gill as T20I openers after Samson grabbed his opportunity with both hands, producing a blistering powerplay display when he stepped in for the injured Gill in the fifth T20I against South Africa.

Sanju Samson celebrates comeback with double milestone in Ahmedabad T20IIND vs SA: Sanju Samson became the seventh Indian to reach 8,000 runs in T20 cricket and also completed 1,000 runs in T20Is during the fifth T20I on Sunday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

How life lessons from Bhagavad Gita helped revive Ishan Kishan's careerInspired by the Bhagavad Gita, Ishan Kishan has found inner peace and adopted a more disciplined approach, which has led Jharkhand to their maiden T20 title in the Syed Mushtaq Ali tournament.

Sanju Samson finally gets his chance as injured Gill out of Ahmedabad T20ISanju Samson finally gets his chance to impress the team management and the selectors as he replaces the injured Shubman Gill for the Ahmedabad T20I against South Africa on Friday, December 19.

India set up blockbuster final vs Pakistan after 8-wicket win against Sri LankaU19 Asia Cup 2025: Ayush Mhatre's India set up a blockbuster final against Pakistan with a commanding eight-wicket win over Sri Lanka on Friday in Dubai. Pakistan handed defending champions Bangladesh an eight-wicket defeat in the other semi-final.

IPL 2026: KKR, PBKS fans rejoice as Finn Allen, Cooper Connolly set BBL on fireKKR and PBKS fans were rejoicing after their new buys Finn Allen and Cooper Connolly set the BBL stage on fire with their explosive batting for the Perth Scorchers during the match against Brisbane Heat on Friday, December 19.

Rohit Sharma not in Mumbai's VHT squad along with Yashasvi, Suryakumar: ReportRohit Sharma, Suryakumar Yadav, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shivam Dube haven't been named in Mumbai's squad for the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy. Rohit could still feature in the tournament once his availability is confirmed.

Suryakumar Yadav unlikely to continue as T20I captain after T20 World Cup: ReportThe BCCI is all set to announce India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad on Saturday, December 20. Captain Suryakumar Yadav, 35, is unlikely to continue beyond the biennial tournament, starting February 7 in India and Sri Lanka.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
